Trainer.synopsis: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.

Trainee2.synopsis: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
Trainee2.how_to_trigger:
from crashsite:
in reCon: teleport S_DEN_Trainee_002

Pickpocket_002.synopsis: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.

AdventurerRobber_Solo.synopsis: Non-critpath. This dialogue occurs when the player speaks to the tiefling boy who stole the necklace from the adventurer. He might still have the necklace depending on the player's choices in the original dialogue.

AD_Trainee3Responses.synopsis: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.

AD_KidTheft.synopsis: Chatter for when the player catches Silfy stealing, OR when the scam works and her partner tells her it's time to leave.

AD_RobberKidTheft.synopsis: The player fails to catch Meli stealing.

AD_CannotFitCrack.synopsis: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.

AD_PickpocketTrader.synopsis: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.

Trainee3.synopsis: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
Trainee3.how_to_trigger:
from crashsite:
in reCon: teleport S_DEN_Trainee_003

HideoutKid_001.synopsis: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
HideoutKid_001.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_Thieflings_Knows_PlayerRobbed4. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_Thieflings_State_HoldingStolen Goods5. teleport S_DEN_ThiefHideoutLeader6. Speak to Mol

RobbedAdventurer.synopsis:
Non-critpath. A human adventurer accuses a tiefling child of stealing a necklace from him. A tiefling guard may intervene if things get out of hand. 

Barth: Angry, but gruff and restrained. 
Meli: Fearless, urging Barth on.
RobbedAdventurer.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Strat the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe denraiddone4. oe rk_startthat will bring you straight to him and the kidNotes: if you need the path where you have the locket you can set "oe rk_getlocket"

AD_Trespassing.synopsis: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.

AD_HideoutTrespass.synopsis: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.synopsis: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

AD_MagicTrick.synopsis: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.

AD_MerchantLeaves.synopsis: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.

AD_GuardAfterKnockout.synopsis: After the confrontation at teh gates where Zevlor and Aradin show down. Ikaron, a tiefling, is pro Zevlor.

AD_KnockedOutAdventurer.synopsis: If the player knocked Barth out during the conflict with Meli, or not.

AD_Trainee1Responses.synopsis: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.

AD_AdventurervsKid.synopsis: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.

AD_AbandonedHideoutThreat.synopsis: When the player goes into the kids' hideout and Mol, the hideout leader, threatens the player. Kid is glad the player is getting threatened.

AD_KidGuardReport.synopsis: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.

Adventurer_Solo.synopsis: Non-critpath. Takes place after the player resolves the confronation between this adventurer and the thiefling boy who stole the adventurer's necklace.

AD_RobberKid.synopsis: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.

HideoutGuard_002.synopsis: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.

Pickpocket_001.synopsis: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)

Trainee1.synopsis: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.

AD_Trainee2Responses.synopsis: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave

AD_HideoutGuards.synopsis: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.

AD_TrainerLessons.synopsis: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.

CaughtThief.synopsis: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.

reasoning: The session 'Trainer' involves teaching kids to defend themselves, which logically precedes any dialogue about the kids being confident they can fight enemies, such as in 'Trainee2' and 'Trainee3'. Therefore, 'Trainer' should come before 'Trainee2' and 'Trainee3'.
The sessions 'Trainee2' and 'Trainee3' both involve tiefling children expressing confidence in fighting goblins. They can occur independently of each other, but both should follow 'Trainer'.

The session 'AD_HideoutLeader' involves the leader of the thieving kids, which can occur after the player has interacted with the kids in training or catching them stealing. Thus, 'AD_HideoutLeader' can follow 'Trainee2' or 'Trainee3'.

The session 'AD_HideoutTrespass' directly involves the player being caught in the hideout, which should occur after any interactions with the hideout leader or kids stealing, so it should come after 'AD_HideoutLeader'.
The sessions 'AD_AbandonedHideoutThreat' and 'AD_KidGuardReport' involve confrontations with the hideout leader and other kids, which would logically follow 'AD_HideoutTrespass'.

The session 'RobbedAdventurer' involves the player witnessing a tiefling child being accused of stealing, which may happen independently of the training sessions but can be part of a narrative arc involving the kids stealing. It doesn’t have direct predecessors.
Sessions like 'Pickpocket_001', 'Pickpocket_002', and others involving theft can be mutually exclusive with the training sessions, as they represent different paths of interaction with the kids.

HideoutKid_001_143.text: Still, you showed you're one of us by taking Mattis' ring. Never saw you coming, did he?

HideoutKid_001_83.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_83.text: Still, you gave Mattis' ring back. Taught him a lesson doing it, too.

HideoutKid_001_7.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_7.text: Still, you went easy on Silfy even though you caught her in your pockets.

HideoutKid_001_67.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_67.text: And for that, you get one more chance.

HideoutKid_001_179.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_179.text: Still, one of my guards said you were nice to him.

HideoutKid_001_53.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_53.text: Still, you've been a friend to us so far.

HideoutKid_001_214.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_214.text: Nobody messes with my family - I'm all they've got.

HideoutKid_001_147.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_147.text: I didn't mean to cause trouble for your people. Should have been more careful.

HideoutKid_001_103.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_103.text: Is that right? Fine, you get one more chance.
HideoutKid_001_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: A beat, she stares the player down. NodeContext: A beat, she stares the player down.

HideoutKid_001_164.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_164.text: You're pests, the lot of you. Stay out of my way, or else.

HideoutKid_001_68.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_68.text: That's the way you want it? Fine.

HideoutKid_001_115.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_115.text: I'll go tell the guards you're pushing us around. See you around, chump.

HideoutKid_001_124.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_124.text: Ugh, get out of my head!

HideoutKid_001_19.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_19.text: That's it. I'm telling the guards what you did. Everything you did!

HideoutKid_001_112.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_112.text: If you don't get out of my way, I'll tear your spine out, whelp.

HideoutKid_001_212.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_212.text: ...Fine. But make any more trouble for us and you'll regret it, drow or not.
HideoutKid_001_212.context: NodeContext: A flicker of hesitation. She's just been intimidated by a drow player into letting their interference slide. She tries to mask it with a tough act.

HideoutKid_001_21.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_21.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001_8.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_8.text: My gang says you've been messing with them. Don't deny it.

HideoutKid_001_158.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_158.text: And I hear you have a problem.

HideoutKid_001_130.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_130.text: A few things are missing from your pack. Is that right?

HideoutKid_001_191.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_191.text: I heard you helped Meli with that locket. I owe you for that.

HideoutKid_001_123.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_123.text: Mirkon says you got him out of a tight spot with some harpies. Gotta say, I'm impressed.

HideoutKid_001_75.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_75.text: You saved Arabella from the druids. Don't know what those bastards would have done.

HideoutKid_001_118.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_118.text: And thanks for going easy on Silfy. Not many marks would've done the same.

HideoutKid_001_169.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_169.text: I appreciate you teaching Mattis a lesson, too. Kid should be more careful with his rings.

HideoutKid_001_37.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_37.text: Why're you running all these schemes and swindles? Risky, you know.

HideoutKid_001_149.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_149.text: I appreciate you teaching Mattis a lesson, too. Kid should be more careful with his rings.

HideoutKid_001_69.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_69.text: And we're happy to be helped. Now, what can I do for you?

HideoutKid_001_57.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_57.text: You'd better keep these kids in check. They won't get off so lightly forever.

HideoutKid_001_202.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_202.text: Is that a fact? I'll tell them to watch their step.
HideoutKid_001_202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed by player threat. NodeContext: Sarcastic, unimpressed

HideoutKid_001_102.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_102.text: What're you doing down in this cave?

HideoutKid_001_109.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_109.text: Making sure we're ready to leave when the time comes.

HideoutKid_001_140.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_140.text: Anyway. You want to talk? Talk.

HideoutKid_001_99.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_99.text: What're you doing down in this cave?

HideoutKid_001_79.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_79.text: Making sure we're ready to leave when the time comes.

HideoutKid_001_184.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_184.text: Why're you running all these schemes and swindles? Risky, you know.

HideoutKid_001_86.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_86.text: We're saving up for a better hideout when we get to Baldur's Gate.

HideoutKid_001_138.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_138.text: Why, you planning on telling me stealing is wrong?

HideoutKid_001_80.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_80.text: Yes. You're taking advantage during bad times. There are words for folk like that.

HideoutKid_001_106.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_106.text: So what? Should we be panicking like everyone else?

HideoutKid_001_161.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_161.text: We have a plan. We're the ones who'll end up on top in the Gate. Anything else?

HideoutKid_001_71.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_71.text: Quite the opposite. I want to invest in the newest thieves' guild on the Sword Coast. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

HideoutKid_001_72.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_72.text: Won't turn down free money. I've got operating costs you wouldn't believe.

HideoutKid_001_197.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_197.text: Come see me in the city sometime, huh? I'll repay this and then some.

HideoutKid_001_16.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_16.text: Not at all. You've got foresight - that'll help you to survive.

HideoutKid_001_104.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_104.text: Foresight's the least of what we've got going, but thanks.

HideoutKid_001_54.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_54.text: I'm not your parent. Do as you please.

HideoutKid_001_180.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_180.text: Didn't need your permission, but fine.

HideoutKid_001_168.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_168.text: Thought you might need help with something.

HideoutKid_001_194.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_194.text: Nothing comes to mind. Always eager to accept donations, though.
HideoutKid_001_194.context: NodeContext: with a shrug and a smile

HideoutKid_001_201.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_201.text: I do, as a matter of fact. Revenge.

HideoutKid_001_114.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_114.text: The bastards that killed Arabella. She was a precious little thing; like a sister to me.

HideoutKid_001_150.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_150.text: I want to steal that big shiny idol they're all chanting at.

HideoutKid_001_166.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_166.text: An idol? What'll you do with something like that?

HideoutKid_001_165.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_165.text: The important thing is to get it away from them. That ritual's gonna get us all killed.

HideoutKid_001_181.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_181.text: And we can sell it once we get to the city. Might be worth enough to pay a priest to bring Arabella back.

HideoutKid_001_173.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_173.text: And we can sell it once we get to the city. Thing like that's gotta be worth a small fortune.
HideoutKid_001_173.context: NodeContext: serious with a touch of excitement

HideoutKid_001_108.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_108.text: I could help you get it, but my time's valuable to me.

HideoutKid_001_55.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_55.text: Sure. When we sell it in the city, I'll make sure you get your cut.

HideoutKid_001_211.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_211.text: I'll see what I can do.

HideoutKid_001_159.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_159.text: Be careful. They look brittle as old bark, but they're vicious.

HideoutKid_001_125.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_125.text: Count me out - I'm not getting involved.

HideoutKid_001_145.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_145.text: Figures. Don't think you've got the stones for the job anyhow.

HideoutKid_001_58.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_58.text: That 'big shiny idol' is part of a sacred ritual. Don't you have any respect?

HideoutKid_001_9.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_9.text: They're murderers. I'd spit in the eye of any god the likes of them worship.

HideoutKid_001_39.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_39.text: That ritual's nothing more than a fancy way to kick us out and leave us for dead.
HideoutKid_001_39.context: NodeContext: irritated, sarcasm and scorn on 'ritual'

HideoutKid_001_151.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_151.text: You saw what those bastards that run the place were doing to Arabella. Scaring the precious mite.

HideoutKid_001_141.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_141.text: I'm shy a few of my belongings - one of your associates robbed me.

HideoutKid_001_207.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_207.text: Maybe one of the kids picked up something of yours by mistake. I couldn't say.

HideoutKid_001_78.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_78.text: Might help if you pay the inspection fee. I could take a look. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

HideoutKid_001_77.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_77.text: Might help if you pay the inspection fee. I could take a look. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

HideoutKid_001_144.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_144.text: Much appreciated. Let's take a look.

HideoutKid_001_133.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_133.text: Give me what's mine, or I'll rip your bloody tail off.

HideoutKid_001_70.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_70.text: Threats, huh? The stones on you. Have it your way.
HideoutKid_001_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cocked head at the threat. Not frightened. NodeContext: A beat before the line, thoughtful, surprised.

HideoutKid_001_17.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_17.text: You idiot. What comes next is on you.

HideoutKid_001_26.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_26.text: I'm sure this was a misunderstanding. My things cost me a lot... I really need them back.

HideoutKid_001_85.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_85.text: Honesty and politeness. I like that.

HideoutKid_001_76.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_76.text: You know what else costs a lot? That inspection fee.
HideoutKid_001_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] set as rerecord to make sure it flows well into new following lineNodeContext: Emphatic, implying the player needs to pay the fee.

HideoutKid_001_132.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_132.text: I forgot it went up a tenday ago. Anyway, pay up, and I'll see what I can do. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

HideoutKid_001_182.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_182.text: Don't be ridiculous. I'm not giving you anything.

HideoutKid_001_170.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_170.text: Then I'm not looking for your stuff. That was easy. Anything else?

HideoutKid_001_110.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_110.text: Looks like some of my possessions have gone 'missing'. Again.

HideoutKid_001_93.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_93.text: Sure. Silfy probably grabbed them by mistake.
HideoutKid_001_93.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent. Silfy stole the items on purpose.

HideoutKid_001_65.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_65.text: Sure. Silfy probably grabbed them by mistake.
HideoutKid_001_65.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent. Silfy stole the items on purpose.

HideoutKid_001_177.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Snaps her fingers, holding out a hand, and a bag is handed to her. She gives it to the player.|

HideoutKid_001_6.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_6.text: Here you go. Won't happen again.

HideoutKid_001_91.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_91.text: And to make sure none of the kids on the job outside mess with you, show them this:

HideoutKid_001_66.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_66.text: I'm not joining your little criminal gang.

HideoutKid_001_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: |PC mimics the hand gesture right.|

HideoutKid_001_90.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_90.text: You got it. Now, we done here or what?

HideoutKid_001_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: |PC mimics the hand gesture wrong.|

HideoutKid_001_196.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_196.text: We took this off you before. Some of it's missing, feels like. But there you go.

HideoutKid_001_204.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_204.text: Ready to pay that inspection fee now? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

HideoutKid_001_10.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_10.text: There's nothing else to be said, for now.

HideoutKid_001_121.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_121.text: You got your junk back. Take it and get out.

HideoutKid_001_30.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_30.text: Well, it's been a pleasure. You know the way out.

HideoutKid_001_178.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_178.context: InternalNodeContext: The idol was moved out of the expected triggers, the player has it and gives it

HideoutKid_001_33.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_33.text: Thanks. See you in Baldur's Gate, I hope. Now scram, before I get emotional.

HideoutKid_001_43.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_43.text: I didn't touch the idol. Don't know what happened to it.
HideoutKid_001_43.context: InternalNodeContext: The idol was moved out of the expected triggers, the player has it and tries to lie about it

HideoutKid_001_45.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_45.text: Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.
HideoutKid_001_45.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

HideoutKid_001_111.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_111.text: You're a terrible liar. We had a deal.
HideoutKid_001_111.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed - player just lied to her and she saw right through it.

HideoutKid_001_92.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_92.text: And now the deal's off. See you around.

HideoutKid_001_171.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_171.text: Fine. Hope the damn thing's cursed.
HideoutKid_001_171.context: NodeContext: frustrated, but not shouting, as she's dismissed. The 'damn thing' is an idol the player stole and refused to give to her

HideoutKid_001_20.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_20.text: Here's some free advice, more valuable than gold: don't bargain, just take.

HideoutKid_001_89.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_89.text: Sounds more like a challenge than advice. Keep an eye on your pack.
HideoutKid_001_89.context: NodeContext: frustrated but with a hint of admiration. Last line is a threat to rob us in the future (pack is backpack). We just conned her, but she learned something from us.

HideoutKid_001_38.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_38.text: Do you have anything to trade?

HideoutKid_001_97.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_97.text: If you change your mind about that fee, you know where to find me.

HideoutKid_001_44.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_44.text: Don't come back unless you want to talk business.

HideoutKid_001_193.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_193.text: You've been a friend to us. Come back any time.

HideoutKid_001_190.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_190.text: Maybe we can do something about this.
HideoutKid_001_190.context: NodeContext: About to scam the player

HideoutKid_001_136.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_136.text: Anyway. You want to talk? Talk.

HideoutKid_001_4.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_4.text: I told you to leave. What happens next is your fault.

HideoutKid_001_35.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_35.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001_122.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_122.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001_11.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_11.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001_148.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_148.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

HideoutKid_001_174.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_174.text: Nothing piques my interest more than being told to stay away from somewhere.

HideoutKid_001_167.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_167.text: We have that in common, then. But you aren't welcome here.

HideoutKid_001_64.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_64.text: Poking your nose in other people's business is the best way to get rich, I find.

HideoutKid_001_73.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_73.text: You ready to tell me what sort of racket you're running down here?

HideoutKid_001_42.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_42.text: We have nothing to talk about.

HideoutKid_001_175.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_175.text: I told you to leave. What happens next is your fault.

HideoutKid_001_27.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001_27.text: I go where I like - told you already. And I'll tell you again if I have to.

HideoutKid_001_208.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_208.text: Fine, then. What happens next is your fault.

HideoutKid_001_29.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_29.text: I had a feeling you'd be back.

HideoutKid_001_82.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_82.text: You. Godsdammit, I warned you to stay away from my kids.

HideoutKid_001_206.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_206.text: What comes next is on you.

HideoutKid_001_87.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_87.text: I'm done with you. You better hope we don't have to talk again.

HideoutKid_001_120.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_120.text: I had a feeling you'd be back.

HideoutKid_001_213.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001_213.text: Had a feeling you'd be back.

RobbedAdventurer_54.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_54.text: Only going to ask you one more time, boy. Hand over my locket.

RobbedAdventurer_83.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_83.text: I don't have your ugly locket. I've never even seen it before!

RobbedAdventurer_164.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_164.text: Hand it over or I'll slap the teeth out of your head.

RobbedAdventurer_176.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_176.text: Relax. The boy's good, but I'm better - here's your locket.

RobbedAdventurer_98.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_98.text: Not bad. Not even a little bit bad.
RobbedAdventurer_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Adventurer and kid look amazd.NodeContext: After a whistle.

RobbedAdventurer_64.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player.NodeContext: Hoarsely, edge of tears.

RobbedAdventurer_160.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_160.text: And you! Stay out of my pockets!

RobbedAdventurer_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Sticks his tongue out at the adventurer and runs off.|

RobbedAdventurer_150.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_150.text: Don't you dare lay a finger on that child.

RobbedAdventurer_136.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_136.text: Forget it. I don't want any trouble.

RobbedAdventurer_122.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_122.text: And I thought he was a coward.

RobbedAdventurer_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: |*The adventurer stares down at the defiant child, wavering, fists clenching*|

RobbedAdventurer_121.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Barth strikes the child Meli. The child cries out in pain.|

RobbedAdventurer_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: The amulet drops from Meli's pockets.

RobbedAdventurer_118.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_118.text: Knew it. Bloody well knew it.
RobbedAdventurer_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Adventurer bends to pick it up

RobbedAdventurer_171.context: CinematicNodeContext: | A nearby guard notices the kid is in trouble.|

RobbedAdventurer_109.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_109.text: You like watching people hit kids? You happy now?
RobbedAdventurer_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kid turns to the player, angry.

RobbedAdventurer_90.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_90.text: Feel better? Or were you hoping I'd cry?
RobbedAdventurer_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: In pain, defiantNodeContext: In pain, defiant

RobbedAdventurer_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: | A nearby guard notices the kid is in trouble.|

RobbedAdventurer_59.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_59.text: You like watching people hit kids? You happy now?
RobbedAdventurer_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kid turns to the player, angry.

RobbedAdventurer_62.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_62.text: You're the one making threats - to a child. Pull yourself together.

RobbedAdventurer_61.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_61.text: Whatever you do to the child, I'll repay ten-fold.
RobbedAdventurer_61.context: InternalNodeContext: Should be Paladin tagged when tag is available.

RobbedAdventurer_167.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_167.text: You don't understand! The kid stole my locket! He... aw, the hells with this.

RobbedAdventurer_89.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_89.text: These little devils get away with everything because of coddling bastards like you.

RobbedAdventurer_180.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_180.text: You'll get yours some day. I hope I get to see it.

RobbedAdventurer_12.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_12.text: Maybe you will. But personally, I doubt it.

RobbedAdventurer_169.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_169.text: Him, I'll hit once. You won't be so lucky. Get out of the way.

RobbedAdventurer_67.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_67.text: Strike the child, go on. See what happens.

RobbedAdventurer_65.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_65.text: Raise a hand to that child and you'll lose it. Your choice.

RobbedAdventurer_56.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_56.text: Gods, don't bleed over the thing. It's just tin and glass.

RobbedAdventurer_135.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_135.text: Guards! This human is trying to hurt me and my friend!

RobbedAdventurer_152.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_152.text: Just warning. I've dealt with your type before, human.

RobbedAdventurer_50.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_50.text: I think it would benefit everyone to calm down here. What happened?

RobbedAdventurer_40.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_40.text: Theft and revenge have already killed a child here. Calm yourselves - explain what happened.

RobbedAdventurer_51.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_51.text: Don't you tell me to calm down - my locket was stolen!

RobbedAdventurer_137.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_137.text: You better do what he says, boy.

RobbedAdventurer_124.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_124.text: I said I don't have it. Maybe he dropped it running away from those big, scary goblins.

RobbedAdventurer_162.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Raising a fist to hit the kid.|

RobbedAdventurer_29.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_29.text: Let us find balance. The child will return the locket - and the adult will act his age.

RobbedAdventurer_68.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_68.text: I get my locket back and you'll have no trouble from me.

RobbedAdventurer_13.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_13.text: You're not fooling anyone, boy. Why'd you take it?

RobbedAdventurer_84.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_84.text: What kind of question is that? Why does anyone steal anything?

RobbedAdventurer_148.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_148.text: Fine. I have the stupid amulet. Take it.
RobbedAdventurer_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rummages in his bag, furious.NodeContext: Furious and a little sad.

RobbedAdventurer_69.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_69.text: I want an answer - why'd you steal it?

RobbedAdventurer_132.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_132.text: To impress a girl, most like.

RobbedAdventurer_104.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_104.text: It looked like my mother's, all right?

RobbedAdventurer_179.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_179.text: Just take the damn thing and leave me alone!
RobbedAdventurer_179.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the amulet back, furious and sad. Wet eyes but not crying.

RobbedAdventurer_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: Long beat from Barth. His expression changes from surprise to an understanding sadness.|

RobbedAdventurer_47.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_47.text: Keep it, kid. You need it more than me.
RobbedAdventurer_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Long beat from Barth. His expression changes from surprise to an understanding sadness before he speaks. NodeContext: Long beat. Gruffly. His mother gave him the amulet.

RobbedAdventurer_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic Node: Meli stares up at Barth in shock, then down at his hands. He turns and runs.|NodeContext: Meli stares up at Barth in shock, then down at his hands. He turns and runs.|

RobbedAdventurer_190.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_190.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPTING: Stares in direction of kid, then turns to walk away.

RobbedAdventurer_46.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_46.text: And I... huh. Someone stole it from me. That's kind of funny.
RobbedAdventurer_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angrily feeling his pouches, then confusion.

RobbedAdventurer_91.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_91.text: Yeah? I'll give you something to laugh about.

RobbedAdventurer_100.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_100.text: Help! This human is trying to kill me!

RobbedAdventurer_36.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_36.text: There. Don't know why you cared so much. It's junk.
RobbedAdventurer_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over locketNodeContext: Hotly, hiding emotion

RobbedAdventurer_156.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_156.text: Scram before I give you something to care about.
RobbedAdventurer_156.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPTING: Meli steps backNodeContext: Kid runs away at end of node.

RobbedAdventurer_112.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_112.text: Huh. Someone stole it from me. That's kind of funny.
RobbedAdventurer_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Patting his pockets, not finding the locket, then speaks.

RobbedAdventurer_151.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_151.text: For the last time, I don't have the stupid thing!

RobbedAdventurer_3.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_3.text: Do you really want to take a beating over some jewellery?

RobbedAdventurer_17.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_17.text: Probably not. It's just tin and glass.

RobbedAdventurer_144.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_144.text: Here, take it. Not sure why you care so much about it, honestly.

RobbedAdventurer_41.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_41.text: A beating, huh? Oh no. Whatever will I do?

RobbedAdventurer_141.context: CinematicNodeContext: | The kid's screaming catches the attention of a nearby guard. |

RobbedAdventurer_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: | *The kid's screaming goes unnoticed. The kid wavers.* |

RobbedAdventurer_117.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_117.text: Doesn't look like they're coming, boy.
RobbedAdventurer_117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cruel satisfactionNodeContext: Cruel satisfaction

RobbedAdventurer_22.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_22.text: I tried to give you a chance. You're on your own.

RobbedAdventurer_53.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_53.text: Just give it back, boy. You're better than this.

RobbedAdventurer_31.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_31.text: Fine! It's just tin and glass anyway.

RobbedAdventurer_4.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_4.text: Thieving children wind up dead around here. Do as he says.

RobbedAdventurer_11.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_11.text: Better do what he says, boy. There's already one thief to bury today.

RobbedAdventurer_102.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_102.text: And both of you thought striking the child was a suitable punishment?
RobbedAdventurer_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player and Barth

RobbedAdventurer_163.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_163.text: If his parents won't do it, I will.

RobbedAdventurer_9.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_9.text: He's an orphan. How'd you like it if I struck you?

RobbedAdventurer_158.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer_158.text: You raise a hand to me, it'd better have steel in it.

RobbedAdventurer_128.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_128.text: Let the boy take it as a warning - he's getting off lightly.

RobbedAdventurer_38.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_38.text: You're not wrong. I wish you were.

RobbedAdventurer_60.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_60.text: Child, learn your lesson and be grateful.

RobbedAdventurer_34.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_34.text: And you, get out of my sight.

RobbedAdventurer_145.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_145.text: He's a thief. Is it any wonder people think that of us all?

RobbedAdventurer_106.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_106.text: My coin's on the tiefling. He looks angry.

RobbedAdventurer_95.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_95.text: No idea. This man just started attacking the boy.

RobbedAdventurer_1.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_1.text: These two outsiders are threatening me, Ikaron.

RobbedAdventurer_129.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_129.text: And that justifies threatening a child?

RobbedAdventurer_134.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_134.text: There's no locket. This bastard's just throwing his weight around.

RobbedAdventurer_147.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_147.text: Nobody's hurting the boy - he's free to leave when he wants.

RobbedAdventurer_101.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_101.text: Good. You heard them, child. You're free to go.

RobbedAdventurer_66.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Barth, then to Meli.

RobbedAdventurer_27.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_27.text: We were wrong to trust you. I see that now.

RobbedAdventurer_125.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_125.text: And you? You had this coming.
RobbedAdventurer_125.context: NodeContext: About to knock someone out.

RobbedAdventurer_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: | Tiefling moves to the adventurer | SCRIPTING: Ikaron steps towards Barth

RobbedAdventurer_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: | Tiefling knocks out the adventurer with a big punch |

RobbedAdventurer_77.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_77.text: Just a misunderstanding. The boy was about to give Barth his locket back.

RobbedAdventurer_178.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_178.text: You're lying. I see it in your face.

RobbedAdventurer_146.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_146.text: I like meddlers - they make funny noises when I smash them. Are you a meddler?

RobbedAdventurer_19.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_19.text: Meddlers are even worse than thieves. You're not meddling, are you?

RobbedAdventurer_183.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_183.text: Child, you promised to stop stealing. You disgrace us all. Give it back.

RobbedAdventurer_45.speaker: Ikaron
RobbedAdventurer_45.text: And now you're threatening me? You fool.

RobbedAdventurer_78.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer_78.text: I'm the one looking out for the boy.

RobbedAdventurer_159.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer_159.text: These two outsiders are threatening me, Ikaron. Even tails over there!

AD_Trespassing_0.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing_0.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

AD_HideoutTrespass_6.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass_6.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

VB_FoundStolenGoods_0.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods_0.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

AD_MagicTrick_4.speaker: Mattis
AD_MagicTrick_4.text: Look - don't take your eyes off my hands.
AD_MagicTrick_4.context: NodeContext: Big brother showing his trick

AD_MagicTrick_8.speaker: Silfy
AD_MagicTrick_8.text: I want to learn a trick too. Something only I know.

AD_MerchantLeaves_0.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves_0.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

AD_GuardAfterKnockout_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_GuardAfterKnockout_0.context: NodeContext: aradin has been knocked out; ikaron is happy

AD_GuardAfterKnockout_1.speaker: Ikaron
AD_GuardAfterKnockout_1.context: NodeContext: Aradin did not get knocked out; Ikaron is sick of the conflict

AD_KnockedOutAdventurer_0.speaker: Barth
AD_KnockedOutAdventurer_0.text: Hey. Come back here, both of you! We ain't done!

AD_KnockedOutAdventurer_1.speaker: Barth
AD_KnockedOutAdventurer_1.context: NodeContext: Growling, slurred, recovering from knockout.

AD_Trainee1Responses_3.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee1Responses_3.text: Throat if you can. Wrist if you can't.

AD_Trainee1Responses_4.speaker: Umi
AD_Trainee1Responses_4.text: Can I have a smaller sword? This one's heavy.

AD_Trainee1Responses_1.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee1Responses_1.text: I'll see if we can find you a dagger, child.
AD_Trainee1Responses_1.context: NodeContext: Sadly. Thinks child is doomed.

AD_Trainee1Responses_8.speaker: Umi
AD_Trainee1Responses_8.text: Sir? Are we gonna have to fight hogboglins?
AD_Trainee1Responses_8.context: NodeContext: Umi says it wrong. Hog+boglin

AD_Trainee1Responses_6.speaker: Umi
AD_Trainee1Responses_6.text: Oh. Are those worse than hogboglins?

AD_AdventurervsKid_0.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid_0.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid_1.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid_1.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

AD_AdventurervsKid_4.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid_4.text: Don't you lie to me, boy. I know you have it.

AD_AdventurervsKid_2.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid_2.text: Touch me and I'll bite your fingers off. I will!

AD_AdventurervsKid_3.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid_3.text: I already told you I don't have it. How stupid are you?

AD_AbandonedHideoutThreat_0.speaker: Mattis
AD_AbandonedHideoutThreat_0.text: You're going to get it now.

AD_KidGuardReport_0.speaker: Mol
AD_KidGuardReport_0.text: Help! They're trying to kill us!

Adventurer_Solo_8.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_8.text: Good to be back behind the walls, have to say. For as long as that lasts.

Adventurer_Solo_26.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_26.text: Not in the mood to talk right now. It ain't you, so leave it.

Adventurer_Solo_47.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_47.text: Hey. Thanks for stepping between me and the kid.

Adventurer_Solo_81.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_81.text: My mum gave me that amulet. But I think she'd be happy knowing the kid has it now.

Adventurer_Solo_62.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_62.text: Thanks to you, I almost lost my locket. My mum gave that to me on her deathbed.

Adventurer_Solo_130.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_130.text: Get out of my face. Got nothing to say to you.

Adventurer_Solo_64.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_64.text: Watch your bags, huh? Learn from my mistakes.

Adventurer_Solo_65.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_65.text: I'll say this for those devils: they know how to throw a punch.

Adventurer_Solo_110.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_110.text: Can't believe the kid thought he could snatch my mum's locket and get away with it.

Adventurer_Solo_9.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_9.text: Bet he's learned his lesson now.

Adventurer_Solo_77.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_77.text: Speaking of the locket... can I have it?

Adventurer_Solo_41.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_41.text: Quit whining, and give me the locket. It'll save me the effort of picking your pocket later.

Adventurer_Solo_21.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_21.text: Tell me you are, and this doesn't have to end in blood.

Adventurer_Solo_23.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_23.text: Blood? Sounds like a happy ending to me.

Adventurer_Solo_72.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_72.text: If you don't want another beating, give me the locket. Now.

Adventurer_Solo_15.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_15.text: My mum gave me that locket on her godsdamned deathbed. The boy took the thing. I know it.

Adventurer_Solo_14.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_14.text: You mean this locket? How much is it worth to you?

Adventurer_Solo_122.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_122.text: How did you... all right, fine. I'll give you some coin for it.

Adventurer_Solo_106.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_106.text: Forget the coin. The locket's yours. Take it.

Adventurer_Solo_98.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_98.text: I... I don't know what to say.

Adventurer_Solo_125.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_125.text: On second thought, I quite like this bauble. Think I'll keep it for myself.

Adventurer_Solo_49.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_49.text: It's gonna be hard to wear a necklace when you ain't got a neck. Give it back.

Adventurer_Solo_128.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_128.text: 'Some coin'? Try 'lots of coin' - or else the trinket stays with me.

Adventurer_Solo_111.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_111.text: Fine. I'll give you everything I've got and you can choke on it for all I care. Give me the amulet.

Adventurer_Solo_7.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_7.text: And here's your reward. We're square now. Get lost.

Adventurer_Solo_88.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_88.text: And it looks like someone took my money too. Got nothing to give you but my thanks.

Adventurer_Solo_67.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_67.text: If that ain't enough, too bad. It's all I got.

Adventurer_Solo_73.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_73.text: On second thoughts, I'm keeping it.

Adventurer_Solo_5.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_5.text: Don't blame you for trying, but I gotta eat. Give me the amulet, I pay you fair, and we're square.

Adventurer_Solo_80.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_80.text: Now hand it over, or we're gonna have problems, you and me.

Adventurer_Solo_28.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_28.text: And here's your reward. We're square now. Get lost.

Adventurer_Solo_48.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_48.text: And it looks like someone took my money too. Got nothing to give you but my thanks.

Adventurer_Solo_29.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_29.text: Then I guess we're going to have problems. Because I'm keeping it.

Adventurer_Solo_61.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_61.text: That's it. That is bloody it.

Adventurer_Solo_42.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_42.text: It's the last thing of mum's I have... it's worth everything to me.

Adventurer_Solo_66.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_66.text: What're you waiting for? I told you I'd give you some coin. Hand it over!

Adventurer_Solo_27.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_27.text: I think you can up your offer a little. It was a gift from your mother, after all.

Adventurer_Solo_52.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_52.text: W-what? Get your head outta my head!

Adventurer_Solo_105.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_105.text: Here's the locket. It's all yours.
Adventurer_Solo_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives amulet to Barth

Adventurer_Solo_121.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_121.text: You found it? I... I don't know what to say.
Adventurer_Solo_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taking locket. NodeContext: Gruff, edge of tears.

Adventurer_Solo_114.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_114.text: I know it's stupid. It's all I have of her, is all.
Adventurer_Solo_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down at the locket. NodeContext: Gruff, edge of tears.

Adventurer_Solo_127.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_127.text: Kind of you, friend. Here's something for your troubles.
Adventurer_Solo_127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Handing over reward. NodeContext: Snuffling.

Adventurer_Solo_116.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_116.text: Heirloom, is it? Been in your family long?

Adventurer_Solo_103.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_103.text: Not much of an heirloom then... unless there's a tale behind it, maybe?

Adventurer_Solo_91.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_91.text: She stole it from a house she cleaned, all right?

Adventurer_Solo_16.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_16.text: They didn't pay her much. They owed her a perk or two.

Adventurer_Solo_94.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_94.text: Let me get this straight - you're annoyed that somebody stole your stolen property?

Adventurer_Solo_13.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_13.text: Ain't the same and you know it.

Adventurer_Solo_100.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_100.text: Anyway, I meant what I said. Thanks for what you did. I gotta go.

Adventurer_Solo_10.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_10.text: Wherever it came from, at least it's something to remember her by.

Adventurer_Solo_53.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_53.text: Anyway, I should go. See you around.

Adventurer_Solo_0.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_0.text: I see. Your blessed mum was providing for her family, but the young tiefling is a thieving devil.

Adventurer_Solo_126.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_126.text: Never said she was an angel, did I? But she sure as hells didn't have horns on her head!

Adventurer_Solo_74.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_74.text: Nothing. I'm sad, is all. Leave it alone.

Adventurer_Solo_58.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_58.text: Well, at least you can have it back now.

Adventurer_Solo_112.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_112.text: Was in another family right up 'til mum stole it. But it's mine now - all I have.

Adventurer_Solo_24.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_24.text: Let me guess - it wasn't your mother's to give you in the first place, was it?

Adventurer_Solo_83.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_83.text: Come on, spit it out. What aren't you telling me about the locket?

Adventurer_Solo_3.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_3.text: Ugh. Get your head outta my head!

Adventurer_Solo_117.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo_117.text: I'll see about getting it back into your hands.

Adventurer_Solo_25.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_25.text: Kind of you to offer, but that boy ain't giving it up, not even to one of his own. I'm sure of it.

Adventurer_Solo_108.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_108.text: And if you twist the pup's arm, he'll yelp, and the wolves'll come running.

Adventurer_Solo_104.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_104.text: Should've seen that, but my temper was up.

Adventurer_Solo_69.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_69.text: I appreciate the kindness friend, but I ain't getting the locket back. Not now.

Adventurer_Solo_36.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_36.text: Kind of you to offer, but that boy ain't giving it up. I'm sure of it.

Adventurer_Solo_68.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_68.text: The nerve of that smirking little rat.

Adventurer_Solo_71.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_71.text: That kid stole the one thing that means anything to me.

Adventurer_Solo_85.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_85.text: Got a beating, thanks to you. But at least I got my locket back.

Adventurer_Solo_86.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_86.text: Someone stole the damn amulet off me again. Don't want to talk about it.

Adventurer_Solo_87.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_87.text: Thanks to you, that kid has my locket. My mum gave that to me on her deathbed.

Adventurer_Solo_90.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_90.text: Thanks to you, that kid has my mum's locket and I got a beating.

Adventurer_Solo_12.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_12.text: Got nothing to say to you. You got nothing I want.

Adventurer_Solo_95.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_95.text: You're all right by me, friend.

Adventurer_Solo_129.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_129.text: I'll say this for you devils: you know how to throw a punch.

Adventurer_Solo_131.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo_131.text: Get out of my face. Got nothing to say to you.

AD_RobberKid_2.speaker: Meli
AD_RobberKid_2.text: I need new pockets to pick.

HideoutGuard_002_0.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002_0.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002_0.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

HideoutGuard_002_1.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002_1.text: Give Mol a tenday and she'll own Baldur's Gate. You'll see.

Pickpocket_001_5.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_5.text: I don't talk to dead scabs, scab. Keep moving.

Pickpocket_001_62.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001_62.text: I'm sorry for taking your ring. Here you go.

Pickpocket_001_21.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_21.text: Huh. Don't think anyone's ever apologised for stealing my stuff before.

Pickpocket_001_270.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_270.text: You know what? We're square. I'll tell the others to leave you alone too.

Pickpocket_001_319.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_319.text: Don't worry about it. Now, you wanna buy something this time?

Pickpocket_001_322.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_322.text: Well, grudges don't buy bread, and I gotta eat. Speaking of which, wanna trade?

Pickpocket_001_67.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001_67.text: While I'm here, could we trade?

Pickpocket_001_65.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_65.text: Uh, hey. You here to trade or...

Pickpocket_001_290.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_290.text: Yeah, I know. I was standing right here, telling her to rob you.

Pickpocket_001_122.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001_122.text: I want an apology from her.

Pickpocket_001_320.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_320.text: Want all you want. She's somewhere safe and staying that way.

Pickpocket_001_268.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001_268.text: You could at least pretend to be sorry.

Pickpocket_001_147.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_147.text: I am sorry! Sorry we're still talking about this.
Pickpocket_001_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sincere, then mocking. NodeContext: Insistent, then mocking.

Pickpocket_001_39.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_39.text: Look, you caught her. Good for you, you aren't a chump like everybody else around here.

Pickpocket_001_345.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_345.text: Now, do me a favour. Make room for the chumps.

Pickpocket_001_161.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001_161.text: You can make it right - by giving me a percentage of your take.

Pickpocket_001_163.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_163.text: Fine. I'm not so good at counting, but I think any percentage of zero is zero.

Pickpocket_001_51.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001_51.text: If you touch my pack again, I'll pull your horns off. Slowly.
Pickpocket_001_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunkers down to speak to her

Pickpocket_001_344.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_344.text: I get it, you're not a chump, but we're just trying to survive.

Pickpocket_001_52.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001_52.text: So move along, okay? Make room for the real chumps.

AD_Trainee2Responses_0.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses_1.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses_1.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses_1.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses_7.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses_7.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_Trainee2Responses_5.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses_5.context: NodeContext: "Am I holding this sword right?"

AD_Trainee2Responses_4.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses_4.text: Almost. Turn your wrist out a little. There.

AD_HideoutGuards_3.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards_3.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards_9.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards_9.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards_2.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards_2.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_HideoutGuards_6.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards_6.text: When do I get to run the ring scam?

AD_HideoutGuards_5.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards_5.text: Silfy needs the practice. You'll be out there soon enough.

AD_HideoutGuards_1.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards_1.text: I bet that scam is going to kill in Baldur's Gate.

AD_HideoutGuards_0.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards_0.text: Don't get too attached to that con, kids. I got bigger plans for the city.

AD_HideoutGuards_10.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards_10.text: Silfy got caught. We have to lay low for a while.

AD_HideoutGuards_7.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards_7.text: Can you stop? It's not like you never got caught.

AD_TrainerLessons_2.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerLessons_2.text: Remember: you have teeth and claws! Use them.

AD_TrainerLessons_3.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerLessons_3.text: Don't fight fair. Fight to live.

AD_TrainerLessons_5.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerLessons_5.text: Am I supposed to hug you, or...

CaughtThief_45.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief_45.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*

CaughtThief_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief_26.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_26.text: Relax, I won't get angry. You didn't even manage to get anything from me.

CaughtThief_47.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still covering her face. NodeContext: Still weepy, muffled

CaughtThief_34.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_34.text: I already took some of your stuff. Brought it back to the hideout. I'm so sorry!

CaughtThief_29.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_29.text: I can't do this anymore, Mattis! I'm sorry!
CaughtThief_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The child rubbed her eyes and took a shuddering breath.*NodeContext: *The child rubbed her eyes and took a shuddering breath.*

CaughtThief_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: |CINEMATIC: NODE: *She sprints away and crawls through a crack in a nearby wall.*|

CaughtThief_28.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_28.text: Well now, someone's starting young. Who taught you that?

CaughtThief_14.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The child rubbed her eyes and took a shuddering breath.*

CaughtThief_24.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_24.text: How... how did you catch me?

CaughtThief_44.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_44.text: How else? You're clumsy. A dead man could've caught you.

CaughtThief_1.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_1.text: Right. You def'nately caught me the first and only time I stole.
CaughtThief_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Awkward lyingNodeContext: She has stolen from the player before. She is a terrible liar.

CaughtThief_18.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_18.text: I guess I'll try harder not to get caught next time. Bye!

CaughtThief_50.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_50.text: You were just unlucky this time. But you've got talent - I can tell.

CaughtThief_6.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_6.text: That's, um, really nice of you.

CaughtThief_36.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_36.text: I... feel like I should say that I already took some of your stuff. Before now, I mean.

CaughtThief_3.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_3.text: I can't give it back, though. It's already in the stash.

CaughtThief_32.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_32.text: Observe her silently. Maybe these are just crocodile tears.

CaughtThief_23.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief_23.text: *You notice she's trembling. The tears streaming down her cheeks are indeed real.*

CaughtThief_25.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_25.text: Lunge at her. Real tears or not, she tried to rob you.

CaughtThief_30.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief_30.text: *Her hands hide her face, preventing you from reading her expression.*

CaughtThief_12.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_12.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief_0.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief_11.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

CaughtThief_16.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tries to grab her, but she escapes their grasp.

CaughtThief_8.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief_8.text: *You see her hand in your bags... and the shame in her heart.*

CaughtThief_43.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_43.text: You don't have what it takes to be a villain. Kill while you smile, steal like you breathe.

CaughtThief_10.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_10.text: Something tells me the thieving life isn't for you.

CaughtThief_5.speaker: Player
CaughtThief_5.text: Lunge at her. Remorse or not, she tried to rob you.
